Add a new analysis name to the database

1 Click Auxiliary Tables on the left side of the main window in DB Editor.

2 Double-click Analyses on the list of database tables on the right side of the main window.

3 Click the Add button to add a new row to the table.

4 On the new row, enter the name of the new analysis.

Example: CBC.

5 In the Index column, enter a number corresponding to the position of the item relative to others in the section and then press Enter.

Tip: Include a zero before single-digit numbers (00, 01, 02...).

This step is optional. If you leave the index blank, sections will appear in the order they were entered.

6 Click Close.

7 Double-click Parts on the list of database tables on the right side of the main window.

8 Click the Add button to add a new row to the table.

9 On the new row, enter the same name as you entered on the Analyses table.

Example: CBC.

10 On the same row, in the Analysis column, select the name you entered on the Analyses table.

Example: CBC.

Next step: Add laboratory components to the database
